definition: to mow grass/haymaking/to write a rough draft (of an essay etc)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others

sentences.english: I know how to be invisible.
sentences.chinese: 我知道如何不打草惊蛇。

sentences.english: Damn, I am good at telling lies!
sentences.chinese: 妈的，我只是撒谎不打草稿。

sentences.english: One, Three teeth, nylon grass cutter.
Damn , I'm good at tekking lies!
sentences.chinese: 该死，我真是说谎不打草稿。

sentences.english: But Gaudí didn't like blueprints or even renderings.
sentences.chinese: 不过，高迪并不喜欢设计蓝图甚至是打草稿。

sentences.english: The above story provided the idiom "Beat the grass and startle the snake".
sentences.chinese: 由此产生了“打草惊蛇”这个成语。

sentences.english: By that time not cause undesired agitation, will also the your wife isn't rapid.
sentences.chinese: 到时不只打草惊蛇，也会令夫人不快。

sentences.english: Can we make notes when we take listening section exam?
sentences.chinese: 现在做听力，在试卷上可以打草稿吗？

sentences.english: Make a draft first, then copy it into our exercise-book.
sentences.chinese: 写作文之前应该先打草稿，然后抄到本子上。

sentences.english: His second impulse therefore was to let sleeping dogs lie .
sentences.chinese: 他的第二个冲动是不必打草惊蛇。

sentences.english: It is the basic component of a shape drawn on paper.
sentences.chinese: 这些是在纸上打草稿的基础。

definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
to accumulate manure/to lay down compost
to harrow/to break the ground with a hoe
to chop wood/to chop down trees
to thresh or husk grain on a threshing ground (dialect)
